mouth.definition: the opening and cavity in the lower part of the human face, surrounded by the lips, through which food is taken in and speech is produced

ear.definition: the organ on the side of the head that detects sound and helps with balance; the external part visible on humans is called the outer ear

tooth.definition: One of the hard, calcified structures in the mouth used for biting and chewing food.

tongue.definition: the muscular organ in the mouth used for tasting, manipulating food, and articulating speech

neck.definition: the part of a person or animal's body that connects the head to the rest of the body

shoulder.definition: the upper jointed part of the human body where the arm connects to the torso, including the surrounding bones, muscles, and joint

arm.definition: the forelimb of the human body, extending from the shoulder to the hand; the part including the upper arm, elbow, forearm, wrist, and hand

elbow.definition: the joint between the upper and lower parts of the human arm that allows it to bend and straighten; the corresponding joint in other animals

wrist.definition: the joint between the forearm and the hand; the part of the arm where the radius and ulna meet the carpal bones

hand.definition: the end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist, including the palm, fingers, and thumb

finger.definition: one of the long, jointed projections attached to the hand, used for feeling, grasping, and manipulating objects

thumb.definition: the short, thick first digit on the human hand, opposable to the other fingers and used for grasping and manipulating objects

chest.definition: the front part of a person or animal's body between the neck and the abdomen, enclosed by the ribcage and containing the heart and lungs

back.definition: the rear surface of a human or animal between the neck and the lower end of the spine; the part of the body opposite the chest

stomach.definition: the abdominal cavity of a human or animal; the organ between the esophagus and the intestines that digests food

leg.definition: one of the limbs on which a person or animal stands and walks; a support or upright member of a piece of furniture or equipment

thigh.definition: The part of the human or animal leg between the hip and the knee.

knee.definition: The joint between the thigh and the lower leg in humans and many animals, allowing the leg to bend and straighten; also the corresponding part on the hind limb of a quadruped.

ankle.definition: the joint between the foot and the leg, or the region surrounding this joint

foot.definition: the terminal part of the leg below the ankle, on which a person stands and walks; also, the paw-like lower part of the leg of certain animals

toe.definition: one of the five digits at the end of the human foot, used for balance and walking

skin.definition: The outer protective layer of tissue covering the body of a person or animal; the epidermis and dermis collectively.

hair.definition: The proteinaceous strands that grow from the skin of humans and animals, typically on the head, used for protection, insulation, and appearance.

bone.definition: A hard, calcified connective tissue that forms the skeleton of vertebrate animals and supports and protects body organs.

muscle.definition: A tissue in a plant or animal composed of fibers that can contract to produce movement or maintain posture; (in animals) any of the contractile organs or tissues (such as skeletal, cardiac, or smooth muscle) attached to bones or surrounding internal organs.

heart.definition: the muscular organ in humans and other animals that pumps blood through the circulatory system

lung.definition: One of the pair of organs in the chest that take in oxygen and remove carbon dioxide for breathing.

brain.definition: The organ inside the skull that controls thought, memory, feelings, and body functions.

kidney.definition: One of a pair of organs in the body that filter waste from the blood and produce urine.

blood.definition: The red fluid that circulates in the bodies of humans and animals, carrying oxygen and nutrients and removing waste.

spine.definition: The column of vertebrae running down the back that supports the body and protects the spinal cord; the backbone.

liver.definition: An internal organ in vertebrates that processes nutrients, detoxifies harmful substances, and produces bile.

chin.definition: The lowermost part of the human face below the mouth, forming the prominence of the jaw.

cheek.definition: The fleshy part of the face below the eye and between the nose and the ear.

jaw.definition: Either of the bony structures forming the upper and lower parts of the mouth, containing the teeth and enabling biting and chewing (the upper jaw = maxilla; the lower jaw = mandible).

throat.definition: The passage at the back of the mouth and nasal cavity that leads to the esophagus and windpipe; the front part of the neck containing the pharynx and larynx.

fingernail.definition: The hard, protective plate at the tip of a human finger.

sweat.definition: Liquid produced by glands in the skin, often as a response to heat, exercise, or stress; perspiration.

tail.definition: The rear appendage of an animal's body, often long and flexible, extending from the backbone.

wing.definition: A limb or appendage used by birds, bats, or insects for flight; a wing-like structure on aircraft or other objects.

tear.definition: A drop of salty liquid produced by the eye, often as a response to emotion, irritation, or injury.

horn.definition: a hard, pointed growth on the head of certain animals such as cattle, goats, or rhinoceroses, made of keratin or bone

flesh.definition: the soft tissue of a body

lip.definition: either of the two fleshy parts forming the edge of the mouth

leaf.definition: a flat, typically green plant organ attached to a stem or branch, where photosynthesis and gas exchange occur

root.definition: The part of a plant that typically grows underground, anchoring the plant and absorbing water and nutrients from the soil.

branch.definition: A woody limb that grows from the trunk or stem of a tree or shrub.

seed.definition: A small reproductive unit produced by a plant that can grow into a new plant.

fruit.definition: The edible reproductive body of a seed plant, typically sweet or sour, eaten as food (singular, base form).

bark.definition: The tough outer covering of a tree trunk and branches.

pollen.definition: Fine powder produced by flowering plants that contains male reproductive cells and can fertilize other plants; often dispersed by wind or animals.

trunk.definition: The main woody stem of a tree that supports branches and transports nutrients and water.

stem.definition: The main structural axis of a plant that supports leaves, flowers, and fruits, and transports water and nutrients.

petal.definition: One of the often brightly colored segments of a flower surrounding the reproductive parts.

thorn.definition: A sharp, pointed projection on a plant stem or branch, serving as a defense mechanism.

bud.definition: A small protuberance on a plant that develops into a leaf, flower, or shoot.

fork.definition: A utensil with a handle and two or more prongs used for spearing and lifting food to eat, or for holding food in place while cutting.

spoon.definition: A small, usually rounded utensil with a shallow bowl and a handle, used for eating, stirring, or serving food and liquids.

cup.definition: a small, open container, typically with a handle, used for drinking liquids such as tea or coffee

plate.definition: a shallow, typically round dish used for serving or eating food

book.definition: a written or printed work consisting of pages bound together along one edge and usually protected by a cover; a single work of literature or non-fiction, or a collection of sheets compiled for reading, study, or reference.

key.definition: A small metal instrument used to operate a lock by fitting into its mechanism and turning to open or close it; (also) any device or code that provides access or control.

cell phone.definition: A portable handheld device used to make and receive voice calls, send messages, and access communication services and the internet; a mobile phone.

watch (timepiece).definition: a small timekeeping device worn on the wrist or carried in a pocket that shows the time

bag.definition: a flexible container made of material such as cloth, paper, or plastic, used for carrying or holding items

wallet.definition: a small flat case, usually folding, used for carrying paper money, credit cards, and identification documents

eyeglasses.definition: A pair of lenses set in a frame worn on the face to correct or protect the eyes (commonly called glasses).

bottle.definition: a typically cylindrical container, usually made of glass or plastic, with a narrow neck and a mouth, used for storing and pouring liquids

box.definition: a container, typically with flat sides and a lid or flaps, used for storing or transporting objects

paper.definition: A thin material made from wood pulp, rags, or other fibrous substances, used for writing, printing, packaging, or wrapping.

mirror.definition: a smooth, polished surface, typically of glass coated with a metal, that reflects a clear image of objects placed in front of it

towel.definition: a piece of absorbent cloth or paper used for drying or wiping a surface, especially the body or hands after washing

knife.definition: A handheld cutting tool consisting of a sharp blade and a handle, used for cutting, slicing, or piercing.

pen.definition: A handheld writing instrument that uses ink to make marks on paper or similar surfaces.

pencil.definition: A slender hand-held writing or drawing instrument with a graphite (or similar) core encased in wood or other material.

comb.definition: A small handheld tool with a row of teeth used to arrange, untangle, or style hair.

toothbrush.definition: A small brush used for cleaning the teeth and gums.

string.definition: A thin, flexible length of fiber, thread, or twine used for tying, fastening, or connecting things; a small cord.

candle.definition: A solid block or stick of wax (or similar material) with a central wick that is lit to produce light, and sometimes scent or heat.

spatula.definition: A flat or broad kitchen tool used for flipping, turning, spreading, or scraping food or mixtures.

umbrella.definition: A handheld device with a collapsible fabric canopy on a frame, used to protect a person from rain or sunlight.

stapler.definition: A handheld device used to fasten sheets of paper together by driving a metal staple through them.

pillow.definition: A soft cushion used to support the head while sleeping or resting.

blanket.definition: A large piece of soft material used to cover oneself, especially while sleeping, to provide warmth.

pan.definition: A shallow, typically metal container with a flat bottom and usually a long handle, used for cooking food on a stovetop.

vase.definition: A decorative container, typically made of glass, ceramic, or metal, used for holding cut flowers or for display.

soap.definition: A substance used with water for cleaning or washing, typically forming a lather.

razor.definition: A handheld tool with a sharp blade used for shaving or removing hair from the skin.

doll.definition: A small model of a human, used as a toy for children.

toy.definition: A small object designed for children to play with for amusement or learning.

chopsticks.definition: A pair of thin wooden, bamboo, or metal sticks used as eating utensils to pick up and hold food, commonly used in East Asian cuisines.

package.definition: A wrapped or boxed object or group of objects bundled together for transport or delivery.

seat.definition: a thing made for sitting on

match (fire).definition: A short, thin stick tipped with a flammable substance that ignites when struck on a rough surface, used for producing fire.

blade.definition: the flat cutting edge of a knife, saw, or other tool or weapon; a thin flat part of something.

lamp.definition: a device for giving light, either electric or using oil or gas.

torch.definition: a portable light source, typically a stick with a flame at one end; a flashlight.

water.definition: A clear, tasteless, odorless liquid essential for life, used for drinking, cooking, cleaning, and other purposes.

coffee.definition: A dark, brewed beverage made from roasted coffee beans, commonly consumed hot for its flavor and caffeine content.

tea.definition: A hot or cold beverage made by infusing cured leaves of the Camellia sinensis plant (or similar herbal infusions) in water; commonly consumed for flavor and stimulant effects.

beer.definition: An alcoholic drink made from fermented cereal grains, usually barley, flavored with hops.

wine.definition: An alcoholic beverage made from fermented grapes (or other fruits), typically consumed as a drink.

milk.definition: A white nutritious liquid produced by mammals (especially cows) used as a beverage or in cooking.

soda.definition: A carbonated beverage, like Coca-Cola.  Sometimes called "pop" in American English.

bread.definition: A staple food made from flour, water, and usually yeast, baked into loaves or other shapes and eaten as part of meals.

meat.definition: The edible flesh of animals used as food.

fish.definition: Fish prepared or caught for eating; the flesh of fish used as food.

egg.definition: A hard‑shelled reproductive body produced by birds (especially chickens) commonly used as food.

cheese.definition: A solid or semi‑solid food made from the curd of milk, often aged or processed and used as food or ingredient.

butter.definition: A dairy product made by churning cream or milk, used as a spread or for cooking.

sugar.definition: A sweet crystalline substance, typically white or brown, used to sweeten food and drinks; commonly produced from sugarcane or sugar beet.

salt.definition: A white crystalline substance (sodium chloride) used to season and preserve food.

potato.definition: An edible starchy tuber grown underground from the plant Solanum tuberosum, commonly used as a vegetable in cooking.

apple.definition: A round, typically red, green, or yellow fruit that grows on apple trees and is eaten raw or used in cooking.

banana.definition: A long curved yellow fruit with soft sweet flesh and a peel, eaten raw or used in cooking.

orange.definition: A round citrus fruit with a thick orange rind and juicy, segmented flesh, commonly eaten fresh or used for juice.

tomato.definition: A red or yellow edible fruit commonly used as a vegetable in cooking, eaten raw or cooked.

onion.definition: A round edible bulb with layered flesh and a strong flavor and smell, used as a vegetable in cooking.

rice.definition: Edible grains produced by the rice plant, commonly cooked and eaten as a staple food.

soup.definition: A liquid dish typically made by boiling meat, fish, vegetables, or legumes in stock or water, often served hot as a starter or main course.

cake.definition: A sweet baked dessert typically made from batter or dough, often with frosting or decorations, served in slices.

chocolate.definition: A sweet food made from cacao beans, often eaten in solid form or used to flavor drinks and confections.

pasta.definition: A food made from an unleavened dough of wheat flour mixed with water or eggs, formed into various shapes (such as spaghetti, penne, or lasagna) and typically cooked by boiling; commonly served with sauces.

pizza.definition: a round, flatbread typically topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and various other ingredients (such as meats, vegetables, or herbs), baked until the crust is cooked and the cheese is melted

sandwich.definition: a food item consisting of two or more pieces of bread with one or more fillings such as meat, cheese, vegetables, or spreads placed between them

salad.definition: A cold dish made from a mixture of raw or cooked vegetables, often combined with a dressing; can include ingredients such as lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, cheese, meat, or grains.

yogurt.definition: A semi-solid food made by fermenting milk with bacterial cultures, typically creamy and tangy; often eaten plain or flavored and used in cooking.

honey.definition: A sweet, viscous substance produced by bees from the nectar of flowers, used as food and sweetener.

jam.definition: A sweet spread or preserve made by cooking fruit with sugar until it thickens, used on bread or pastries

pickle.definition: a cucumber that has been preserved in a brine or vinegar solution and often flavored with spices

mustard.definition: A pungent yellow or brown paste or sauce made from ground mustard seeds, vinegar, water, and often other seasonings, used as a condiment; or the seeds of the mustard plant used as a spice.

ketchup.definition: A thick, tangy condiment made from tomatoes, vinegar, sugar, and spices, typically used as a sauce for foods such as fries and burgers.

mayonnaise.definition: A thick, creamy cold sauce or condiment made from oil, egg yolks, and vinegar or lemon juice, often used on sandwiches and in salads.

vinegar.definition: A sour-tasting liquid produced by the fermentation of ethanol by acetic acid bacteria, used as a condiment, preservative, or cleaning agent.

cooking oil.definition: A vegetable or animal oil used for frying, baking, or otherwise preparing food.

flour.definition: Powder made by grinding grains, especially wheat, used as the main ingredient in bread, cakes, and other baked goods.

corn.definition: Edible yellow kernels from the maize plant, used as food for humans and livestock.

bean.definition: A small, edible seed from various leguminous plants (especially of the family Fabaceae), often used as a vegetable or cooked food (e.g., kidney bean, black bean, green bean).

pea.definition: A small spherical green seed of the Pisum sativum plant, eaten as a vegetable either fresh, frozen, or canned.

lemon.definition: A yellow citrus fruit with sour juice and a thick rind.

lime.definition: a small citrus fruit with green skin and acidic juice, used for cooking, flavoring, and beverages.

grape.definition: A small, round or oval fruit that grows in clusters on a grapevine, typically sweet or tart and used for eating fresh, drying into raisins, or fermenting to make wine.

strawberry.definition: A sweet, red, fleshy fruit with seeds on its surface, produced by the strawberry plant (genus Fragaria).

blueberry.definition: A small round fruit with dark blue to purple skin and sweet-tart flesh.

raspberry.definition: A sweet, soft, red or black edible fruit made up of many small drupelets.

cherry.definition: A small, round, typically red or dark-purple stone fruit with a single hard seed (pit) and sweet or tart flesh.

peach.definition: a soft, round fruit with fuzzy skin, yellow or pinkish flesh, and a large central pit; the edible fruit of the peach tree (Prunus persica).

pear.definition: A sweet, edible fruit with a rounded base and tapering top.

watermelon.definition: A large, round or oblong fruit with a hard green rind, sweet watery red or pink flesh, and black seeds; commonly eaten fresh and known for its high water content.

melon.definition: A large, juicy fruit with a thick rind and sweet flesh, typically from plants of the genus Cucumis or Citrullus (such as cantaloupe or watermelon).

pineapple.definition: A tropical fruit with rough, spiky skin, sweet yellow flesh, and a central core; edible raw or used in cooking and canning.

mango.definition: A tropical fruit with sweet, juicy orange-yellow flesh and a large flat seed.

coconut.definition: The large round seed or fruit of the coconut palm (Cocos nucifera), with a hard fibrous shell and edible white flesh and coconut water inside.

walnut.definition: the large edible nut of the walnut tree, with a hard wrinkled shell and a rich oily kernel

almond.definition: A small, oval edible nut with a hard, brown shell and a pale, creamy kernel.

peanut.definition: a small oval edible seed (legume) of the peanut plant, typically enclosed in a two-chambered, brittle shell; eaten roasted, boiled, or used to make peanut butter and oil.

mushroom.definition: a type of fungus with a fleshy, typically umbrella-shaped fruiting body that produces spores, often with a stem and cap; some species are edible and others are poisonous

garlic.definition: A bulbous plant (Allium sativum) whose pungent cloves are used as a seasoning in cooking and for medicinal purposes.

cabbage.definition: A leafy green or purple vegetable with a dense, rounded head of leaves.

lettuce.definition: A leafy green vegetable (Lactuca sativa) commonly eaten raw in salads and as a sandwich ingredient.

spinach.definition: A leafy green flowering plant (Spinacia oleracea) cultivated as a vegetable, eaten cooked or raw for its edible leaves.

broccoli.definition: A green edible plant (Brassica oleracea var. italica) with a thick stalk and a flowering head composed of small, tightly clustered florets, commonly cooked or eaten raw as a vegetable.

cauliflower.definition: A large edible plant in the cabbage family (Brassica oleracea, variety botrytis) with a compact head of undeveloped white or colored flower buds, commonly cooked and eaten as a vegetable.

pepper.definition: A pungent, usually dried or ground spice made from the berries of the Piper nigrum plant (black, white, or green pepper), used to season food.

cucumber.definition: A long, green-skinned, cylindrical edible fruit with a crisp, watery flesh, commonly eaten raw in salads or pickled.

celery.definition: a crunchy, pale-green stalked vegetable (Apium graveolens) eaten raw or cooked, often used in salads, soups, and as a flavoring

radish.definition: A small, crisp, edible root vegetable, typically red or white, eaten raw in salads or as a garnish.

beet.definition: a round, typically red or purple root vegetable (Beta vulgaris) eaten cooked, pickled, or raw, commonly known as beetroot

turnip.definition: a round, white or purple-rooted root vegetable (Brassica rapa) commonly grown for its edible taproot and leaves; used for cooking and animal fodder.

sausage.definition: A food made from ground meat, fat, salt, and seasonings, usually stuffed into a casing and cooked, smoked, or cured.

ham.definition: A cut of pork from the hind leg of a pig, often cured, smoked, or salted and commonly served cooked or sliced.

bacon.definition: Cured and smoked pork, typically from the belly or back, sliced and cooked until crisp or used as an ingredient to add smoky, salty flavor.

chicken meat.definition: Meat from a chicken, especially prepared for eating.

beef.definition: The flesh of cattle (cow or ox) used as meat for food.

pork.definition: meat from a pig, used as food; the flesh of swine when prepared for eating

lamb.definition: The flesh of a young sheep used as food.

salmon.definition: A large migratory fish of the family Salmonidae, typically living in the ocean and returning to freshwater rivers to spawn; often pink to orange-fleshed and commonly eaten.

tuna.definition: A large, fast-swimming marine fish of the family Scombridae, commercially important as food and commonly canned or sold fresh; includes species such as the Atlantic bluefin, yellowfin, and albacore.

shrimp.definition: a small marine crustacean with an elongated body, long antennae, and ten legs, often harvested for food; smaller than a prawn

crab.definition: a marine or freshwater crustacean of the infraorder Brachyura, having a short, broad body covered by a hard shell (carapace), five pairs of legs (the front pair often modified as pincers), and moving sideways

lobster.definition: a large marine crustacean with a hard protective exoskeleton, five pairs of legs including large front claws, and a segmented body and tail, often caught for food

carrot.definition: A long, tapering orange root vegetable that is commonly eaten raw or cooked.

banquet.definition: A large formal meal or feast for many people, often held to celebrate a special event.

breakfast.definition: The first meal of the day, typically eaten in the morning.

lunch.definition: A meal eaten around the middle of the day (around noon); the midday meal.

dinner.definition: The main meal of the day, typically eaten in the evening (the evening meal).

sour cream.definition: a dairy product obtained by fermenting regular cream with certain kinds of lactic acid bacteria

food.definition: any nutritious substance that people or animals eat

aspirin.definition: A common medication used to reduce pain, fever, and inflammation, and as a blood thinner to prevent heart attacks and strokes.

shirt.definition: A garment for the upper body, typically with sleeves and a collar, that buttons down the front or slips on over the head.

pants.definition: A garment covering the body from the waist to the ankles, with separate sections for each leg; worn over the lower body.

dress.definition: A one-piece garment for the body that covers the torso and extends over the hips and sometimes the legs, typically worn by women or girls.

coat.definition: An outer garment with sleeves, typically worn over other clothes for warmth or protection from the weather.

jacket.definition: A casual outer garment with sleeves worn for warmth or weather protection, such as a windbreaker, puffer jacket, or denim jacket.

shoe.definition: A covering for the foot, typically made of leather, rubber, or fabric, worn outdoors to protect and support the foot and provide traction.

sock.definition: A garment made of fabric worn on the foot and often covering the ankle and lower calf; typically worn inside shoes to keep the foot warm and absorb sweat.

hat.definition: A head covering, typically made of cloth, felt, straw, or similar material, worn for warmth, protection, or fashion.

glove.definition: A covering for the hand, typically with separate sections for each finger, worn for protection, warmth, or hygiene.

tie.definition: A long, narrow piece of cloth worn around the neck and tied in a knot or bow at the front, typically as part of formal or business dress.

sweater.definition: A knitted garment worn on the upper body, typically with long sleeves, designed to provide warmth.

underwear.definition: Clothing worn next to the skin, under outer garments, such as underwear items like briefs, boxers, bras, panties, and undershirts.

skirt.definition: A piece of clothing that hangs from the waist and covers part of the legs, worn mainly by women.

bra.definition: A woman's undergarment worn to support and cover the breasts.

belt.definition: A band, usually of leather or fabric, worn around the waist to hold up clothing or as a decorative accessory.

earring.definition: A piece of jewelry worn on the ear (often on the earlobe) for decoration.

ring (jewelry).definition: A small circular band, typically made of metal or other material, worn on a finger as jewelry or ornament.

scarf.definition: A piece of fabric worn around the neck or head for warmth, protection, or decoration.

sandal.definition: A light shoe consisting of a sole held to the foot by straps or thongs, typically worn in warm weather.

pajamas.definition: Loose garments worn for sleeping or lounging, typically consisting of a top and trousers or a one-piece suit.

jeans.definition: A pair of trousers made from denim or similar sturdy cotton fabric, typically blue, worn as casual clothing.

apron.definition: A protective garment worn over the front of the body to protect clothing while cooking, cleaning, or performing work.

raincoat.definition: A waterproof or water-resistant coat worn to protect the wearer from rain.

business suit.definition: A matching set of jacket and trousers (or skirt) worn for professional or formal business occasions.

shorts.definition: A garment worn on the lower body that covers the waist and extends to above or around the knees; short trousers designed for warm weather or athletic use.

suit.definition: A set of matching outer garments, typically consisting of a jacket and trousers or a skirt, worn together as a coordinated outfit.

pocket.definition: A small pouch or compartment sewn into or onto a garment, used for carrying small items.

clothing.definition: items worn to cover the body

dog.definition: A domesticated canine animal (Canis familiaris) kept as a pet, for companionship, or for work such as guarding or herding.

cat.definition: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal kept as a pet or for catching mice, typically with soft fur, a short snout, and retractile claws.

bird.definition: A warm-blooded, egg-laying vertebrate with feathers, wings, and usually the ability to fly; members of class Aves.

horse.definition: A large domesticated mammal with a mane and tail, used for riding, racing, or pulling loads.

cattle.definition: Large domesticated bovine animals raised for milk, meat, leather, or as draft animals.

pig.definition: A domesticated hoofed mammal raised for meat (pork) and other products; typically Sus scrofa domesticus.

chicken.definition: a domesticated fowl (Gallus gallus domesticus) kept for its eggs and meat; an adult female is specifically called a hen

mouse.definition: A small rodent with a pointed snout, rounded ears, and a long tail, typically living in or near human dwellings.

bear.definition: A large mammal with a thick fur coat, a bulky body, and a short tail, living in forests or mountains. Bears are omnivores and may hibernate in winter.

wolf.definition: a large carnivorous mammal (Canis lupus) of the dog family, typically living and hunting in packs and found in wild habitats across the Northern Hemisphere

rabbit.definition: A small mammal with long ears, soft fur, and a short tail, often kept as a pet or found in the wild.

whale.definition: A large marine mammal that lives in the ocean and is known for its size and singing sounds.

tiger.definition: A large wild cat with orange fur and black stripes, known for its strength and agility.

snake.definition: A snake is a long, legless reptile that moves by slithering and often has scales.

elephant.definition: A very large gray mammal with a long trunk and tusks; native to Africa and Asia.

shark.definition: A large sea fish with a skeleton made of cartilage; a predator known for its sharp teeth.

owl.definition: A nocturnal bird of prey with a flat face and large forward-facing eyes, known for hunting at night and often symbolizing wisdom.

spider.definition: A small arthropod with eight legs that often spins webs to catch insects.

squirrel.definition: A small to medium-sized rodent with a bushy tail, typically living in trees and feeding on nuts and seeds.

goat.definition: A small to medium-sized hoofed mammal (Capra aegagrus hircus) kept for milk, meat, fiber, or as a domestic farm animal.

goose.definition: A large waterfowl with a long neck, webbed feet, and a flat bill, commonly kept domestically or found wild (singular).

duck.definition: A waterbird with a broad body, short legs, a flat bill, and webbed feet, commonly found in ponds, lakes, and rivers.

frog.definition: A small tailless amphibian with a short body, long hind legs for jumping, smooth moist skin, and bulging eyes, typically living near water.

butterfly.definition: A flying insect with two pairs of large, often colorful wings and a slender body; undergoes metamorphosis from caterpillar to adult.

turtle.definition: A reptile with a hard shell covering its body, typically living in water or on land and able to retract its head and legs into its shell.

crow.definition: A medium- to large-sized passerine bird of the genus Corvus, with glossy black plumage, a strong stout bill, and a loud harsh "caw" call; known for high intelligence and adaptable omnivorous feeding habits.

eagle.definition: A large bird of prey with a hooked beak and strong talons, known for keen eyesight and powerful flight.

sheep.definition: A domesticated, woolly mammal kept by humans for its wool, meat, and milk; refers to an individual of the species (Ovis aries).

dragon.definition: a mythical creature typically depicted as a large reptile with wings

animal.definition: a living organism that feeds on organic matter

creature.definition: a living being, especially an animal

monster.definition: an imaginary creature that is large and frightening

monday.definition: the day of the week between Sunday and Tuesday; the first day of the standard workweek (Monday).

tuesday.definition: the day of the week between Monday and Wednesday; the second day of the week (commonly considered the third day in some calendars)

wednesday.definition: the day of the week between Tuesday and Thursday; the third day of a standard seven-day week.

thursday.definition: the fourth day of the week, following Wednesday and preceding Friday

friday.definition: the day of the week between Thursday and Saturday; the sixth day of the week in some calendars and the fifth in others, commonly considered the last weekday before the weekend

saturday.definition: the seventh day of the week, following Friday and preceding Sunday; the day commonly observed as a day of rest or leisure in many countries

sunday.definition: the day of the week between Saturday and Monday; the day traditionally observed as the Christian sabbath (often considered the first day of the week).

january.definition: the first month of the year in the Gregorian and Julian calendars, consisting of 31 days

february.definition: the second month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, having 28 days in common years and 29 days in leap years

march.definition: The third month of the year; after February and before April

april.definition: the fourth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, between March and May, typically 30 days long

may.definition: May: the fifth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, occurring between April and June.

june.definition: the sixth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, between May and July; typically associated with the start of summer in the Northern Hemisphere

july.definition: the seventh month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, following June and preceding August

august.definition: August: the eighth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, following July and preceding September.

september.definition: The ninth month of the Gregorian calendar, containing 30 days.

october.definition: the tenth month of the Gregorian calendar, occurring between September and November

november.definition: the eleventh month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, between October and December

december.definition: the twelfth month of the year in the Gregorian and Julian calendars, consisting of 31 days

christmas.definition: the annual Christian and cultural festival, celebrated on December 25, commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ; also used for the holiday season around that date

easter.definition: The Christian festival commemorating the resurrection of Jesus Christ, observed on a Sunday in spring; also used for various related religious services and public holidays. (Also used as a proper noun in names like Easter Monday.)

new year.definition: The first day of the calendar year (January 1) or the period around the start of the calendar year, often celebrated with traditions and festivities.

independence day.definition: a public holiday commemorating the anniversary of a country's declaration or achievement of independence from foreign rule or control

life.definition: the existence of an individual human or animal; the period during which someone or something is alive

day.definition: A period of 24 hours, especially from midnight to midnight; the time between one midnight and the next, or the period of daylight between sunrise and sunset.

night.definition: The period of darkness in each twenty-four hours; the time from sunset to sunrise when it is dark outside.

morning.definition: the period of time from sunrise until midday; the early part of the day

evening.definition: the period of time at the end of the day, typically from late afternoon until nightfall

year.definition: a period of twelve months, corresponding to the time it takes the Earth to complete one orbit around the Sun

month.definition: A period of roughly four weeks or one of the twelve named divisions of a year, based on the cycle of the moon or the calendar (e.g., January, February).

week.definition: a period of seven consecutive days, usually starting on Monday or Sunday, used as a unit of time

hour.definition: a unit of time equal to 60 minutes; one of the 24 equal parts of a day

minute.definition: A unit of time equal to sixty seconds or one sixtieth of an hour.

moment.definition: a very short period of time; an instant

death.definition: The permanent end of all biological functions that sustain a living organism; the cessation of life.

past.definition: the period of time that has already happened; events and experiences that belong to an earlier time

age.definition: the length of time someone has lived or something has existed

winter.definition: the coldest season of the year

summer.definition: the warmest season of the year

spring.definition: the season between winter and summer when plants begin to grow

autumn.definition: the season between summer and winter; fall.

season.definition: one of the four divisions of the year; a period of the year characterized by particular conditions or activities.

century.definition: a period of one hundred years.

period.definition: a length or portion of time

atlantic ocean.definition: The second-largest ocean, separating the Americas from Europe and Africa.

pacific ocean.definition: The largest and deepest ocean, extending from the Arctic Ocean in the north to the Southern Ocean in the south.

indian ocean.definition: The third-largest ocean, bounded by Asia to the north, Africa to the west, and Australia to the east.

baltic sea.definition: a large marginal sea of the Atlantic Ocean in Northern Europe, bordered by Sweden, Finland, Russia, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Germany, and Denmark

mediterranean sea.definition: The sea connected to the Atlantic Ocean between southern Europe, North Africa, and the Near East; bounded by Spain, France, Italy, Greece, Turkey, and the North African countries (commonly called the Mediterranean).

war.definition: An organized, prolonged conflict between states, societies, or groups, typically involving armed forces and sustained military operations.

end.definition: the final part or conclusion of something

course.definition: a series of lessons or lectures on a particular subject

battle.definition: a fight or conflict between armed forces

journey.definition: an act of traveling from one place to another

step.definition: a stage in a process or course of action

party.definition: a social gathering of people for celebration or entertainment

race.definition: a competition of speed between runners, vehicles, or other participants

practice.definition: the actual application or exercise of an idea

blow.definition: a powerful stroke with the hand or weapon

training.definition: the action of teaching a skill

flight.definition: the action or process of flying through the air

charge.definition: a headlong rush forward, especially in an attack

change.definition: the act or process of making or becoming different

escape.definition: an act of breaking free from confinement or control; a means of escaping; avoidance of danger.

meeting.definition: an assembly of people for a purpose; an encounter or coming together.

show.definition: a performance or exhibition; a display or demonstration; an outward appearance.

beginning.definition: the point in time or space at which something starts; the first part or earliest stage.

wood.definition: The hard fibrous material that makes up the trunk and branches of trees, used for construction, fuel, and making objects.

metal.definition: a class of solid materials, typically hard, lustrous, malleable, and conductive of heat and electricity, including elements such as iron, copper, and gold

iron.definition: a strong, hard, silvery-gray metal (chemical element Fe) used widely in construction and manufacturing; also, an alloy of iron and carbon such as steel

steel.definition: A hard, strong alloy of iron and carbon (and often other elements) used for construction, tools, machinery, and other durable goods.

aluminum.definition: A silvery-white, lightweight metallic element (chemical symbol Al, atomic number 13) used in manufacturing, packaging, and construction for its corrosion resistance and conductivity.

copper.definition: a reddish-brown metallic chemical element (symbol Cu) used as a conductor of electricity and heat, in wiring, plumbing, and alloys such as bronze and brass

gold.definition: a dense, soft, yellow precious metal (chemical element gold, symbol Au, atomic number 79) used for jewelry, currency, and electronics; also any gold-colored alloy or coating.

silver.definition: a lustrous, malleable, white metallic chemical element (Ag) used in coins, jewelry, and electrical conductors

plastic.definition: a synthetic material made from polymers that can be molded or shaped when soft and then set into a rigid or slightly flexible state; used to make a wide variety of products.

rubber.definition: a tough, elastic polymer material (natural or synthetic) used for making tires, seals, hoses, and elastic goods; (also) an object made from this material, e.g., an eraser (chiefly British)

glass.definition: a hard, brittle, typically transparent material made by fusing silica with soda, lime, and other substances and cooling rapidly; used for windows, bottles, and other objects

cardboard.definition: A stiff, thick paper material made by compressing layers of paper pulp, used for making boxes, cartons, and other packaging, and for backing and mounting.

cloth.definition: A material made by weaving, knitting, or bonding fibers together, used for making clothing, linens, and other textiles.

cotton.definition: a soft, fluffy white fiber that grows around the seeds of cotton plants and is used to make textiles and other products

wool.definition: the soft, curly hair or fleece of sheep and certain other animals, often spun into yarn and used to make textiles and clothing

silk.definition: A fine, strong fiber produced by silkworms and used to make a smooth, lustrous fabric; a fabric woven from this fiber.

leather.definition: tough, flexible material made from the tanned hides of animals, typically used for clothing, footwear, furniture, and accessories

stone.definition: a hard, solid nonmetallic mineral substance of which rock is made, typically composed of one or more minerals

marble.definition: A hard, fine-grained metamorphic rock, typically white or veined, used for sculpture and as a building material.

concrete.definition: a building material made from a mixture of cement, water, sand, and aggregate that hardens into a solid, stone-like mass

brick.definition: a rectangular block of clay or other material, typically hardened by heat, used in building walls and other structures

ceramic.definition: a hard, brittle, heat-resistant material made by shaping and then firing a nonmetallic mineral, such as clay; objects made from this material (e.g., pottery, tiles, sanitary ware).

clay.definition: A natural earthy material composed mainly of fine-grained minerals (such as hydrous aluminum silicates) that becomes plastic when wet and hardens when dried or fired; commonly used for pottery, bricks, and ceramics.

sand.definition: Fine granular particles of rock and mineral, typically composed of silica (quartz), that form beaches, dunes, and sedimentary deposits and feel gritty to the touch.

air.definition: the invisible mixture of gases surrounding the earth

dust.definition: fine dry powder consisting of tiny particles

wire.definition: a thin flexible strand of metal

poison.definition: a substance that causes harm or death

board.definition: a long thin flat piece of wood

boy.definition: a male child or young male person; a son or young male under the age of adulthood (often used to contrast with 'girl')

girl.definition: a female child or young woman (commonly used for a person who is not yet an adult)

friend.definition: a person whom one knows, likes, and trusts; someone who provides companionship, support, or help

person.definition: a human being; an individual of the species Homo sapiens

human.definition: a person; a member of the species Homo sapiens

enemy.definition: a person who is hostile or opposed to someone

giant.definition: an imaginary being of great size

baby.definition: a very young child or infant.

stranger.definition: a person whom one does not know; a foreigner or outsider.

prisoner.definition: a person confined in prison or held in captivity.

lithuania.definition: A country in northeastern Europe on the eastern shore of the Baltic Sea; one of the three Baltic states, with capital Vilnius.

latvia.definition: a country in Northern Europe on the eastern shore of the Baltic Sea; capital: Riga.

estonia.definition: a country in Northern Europe on the eastern coast of the Baltic Sea, bordered by Latvia to the south and Russia to the east; capital: Tallinn.

poland.definition: a country in Central Europe, officially the Republic of Poland, bordered by Germany, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Ukraine, Belarus, Lithuania, and the Baltic Sea; capital: Warsaw.

germany.definition: a country in central Europe; officially the Federal Republic of Germany, bordered by Denmark, Poland, Czech Republic, Austria, Switzerland, France, Luxembourg, Belgium, and the Netherlands, with capital Berlin.

france.definition: a country in Western Europe occupying most of the territory between the Mediterranean Sea and the English Channel; officially the French Republic, capital Paris.

spain.definition: a country in southwestern Europe occupying most of the Iberian Peninsula; capital city Madrid

italy.definition: A country in southern Europe whose capital city is Rome, located between the Mediterranean and Adriatic seas

russia.definition: a country in Eastern Europe and Northern Asia; the largest country in the world by area, officially called the Russian Federation

england.definition: a country in northwestern Europe that occupies most of the central and southern part of the island of Great Britain; a constituent country of the United Kingdom, whose capital is London.

united states.definition: a country in North America comprising 50 states and a federal district; officially the United States of America, bordered by Canada to the north and Mexico to the south; capital: Washington, D.C.

canada.definition: a country in North America occupying most of the northern part of the continent; a federation of ten provinces and three territories whose capital is Ottawa

japan.definition: Japan: a country in East Asia located in the northwest Pacific Ocean, consisting of an archipelago including the main islands Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, and Shikoku; capital Tokyo.

china.definition: A country in East Asia, officially the People's Republic of China, which borders Russia, India, Southeast Asia, and is across a sea from Japan and the Philippines

india.definition: a country in South Asia occupying the greater part of the Indian subcontinent; the Republic of India

brazil.definition: a country in South America occupying much of the eastern part of the continent; the largest country in both South America and the Latin American region (officially the Federative Republic of Brazil).

australia.definition: a country and continent in the Southern Hemisphere comprising the Australian mainland, the island of Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands; capital: Canberra.

sweden.definition: a country in northern Europe occupying the eastern part of the Scandinavian Peninsula; capital Stockholm.

norway.definition: a country in northern Europe occupying the western portion of the Scandinavian Peninsula; capital: Oslo.

finland.definition: a country in Northern Europe occupying the eastern part of the Scandinavian Peninsula, bordered by Sweden, Norway, and Russia, with Helsinki as its capital.

saw.definition: A hand or power tool with a serrated metal blade used for cutting wood, metal, or other materials.

machine.definition: a mechanical apparatus using energy to perform tasks

lock.definition: a mechanism for securing a door or container

hammer.definition: a hand tool with a heavy head used for driving nails or breaking things

screwdriver.definition: a hand tool for turning screws with a slotted tip that fits into the screw head

drill.definition: a power or hand tool for making holes in hard materials

wrench.definition: a hand tool for gripping and turning nuts, bolts, or pipes

ladder.definition: a structure with rungs or steps for climbing up or down

scissors.definition: a cutting instrument with two blades joined by a pivot

family.definition: A group of people related by blood, marriage, adoption, or a close, supportive domestic relationship; also, all descendants of a common ancestor.

mother.definition: a female parent; a woman who has given birth to or legally is the parent of a child, or who raises and cares for a child

father.definition: a male parent; a man who has begotten or legally raised a child

brother.definition: A male sibling; a boy or man who has the same parent or parents as another person, or who is regarded as having a similar relationship (e.g., in a religious or fraternal context).

sister.definition: a female who has one or both parents in common with another person; a woman or girl in relation to her siblings

son.definition: a male child in relation to his parents

daughter.definition: a female child in relation to her parents; a woman considered as the offspring of her mother and father

uncle.definition: the brother of one's father or mother; or the husband of one's aunt

aunt.definition: the sister of one's father or mother, or the wife of one's uncle

partner.definition: a person's romantic or life companion; someone with whom one shares an intimate, committed relationship

spouse.definition: a person who is married to another; a husband or wife

grandfather.definition: the male parent of a person's father or mother; the father of one's father or mother

grandmother.definition: the female parent of a person's mother or father; the mother of one's mother or father

grandson.definition: a male child of one's son or daughter; the son of one's child

granddaughter.definition: a daughter of one's son or daughter; the female child of one's child

nephew.definition: A son of one's sibling or of one's sibling-in-law.

niece.definition: A daughter of one's brother or sister, or the daughter of one's brother-in-law or sister-in-law.

fiancé.definition: a man to whom someone is engaged to be married

fiancée.definition: a woman who is engaged to be married

boyfriend.definition: a male partner in a romantic or dating relationship

girlfriend.definition: a female with whom someone is in a romantic or dating relationship; a woman who is a person's romantic partner

husband.definition: a married man in relation to his spouse.

cousin (male).definition: a male child of one's uncle or aunt; a relative who shares a common grandparent

cousin (female).definition: The female child of one's aunt or uncle; a person who shares a common grandparent with another person.

excuse me.definition: A polite expression used to get someone's attention or to apologize for interrupting or bothering someone.

yes.definition: An affirmative response or expression indicating agreement, consent, or a positive answer.

no.definition: A word used to express negation, refusal, or denial (opposite of yes).

please.definition: A polite word used to make requests or ask for something courteously.

maybe.definition: A response indicating uncertainty or possibility; neither a definite yes nor no.

you're welcome.definition: A polite response to thank you, acknowledging the gratitude.

sorry.definition: An expression of apology or regret.

hello.definition: A greeting used when meeting or acknowledging someone.

goodbye.definition: A farewell expression used when parting.

who.definition: used to ask about the identity of a person or people; which person or people (e.g., "Who is at the door?").

what.definition: (pronoun) Used to ask for information about something or to request specification or identification (e.g., “What is your name?” “What did you say?”).

where.definition: In or to what place; at or in which (used to ask about or refer to location).

when.definition: at or during which time; at what time (used to ask about or refer to a time) — e.g., “When will you arrive?”

why.definition: used to ask for a reason or explanation; for what cause or purpose (e.g., “Why did you leave?”).

how.definition: In what way or manner; by what means. Used to ask about the manner, condition, or reason of something (e.g., “How did you do that?”) or to introduce clauses describing manner (e.g., “I know how to solve it”).

which.definition: used to ask about one or more items from a defined set or to introduce a clause giving more information about a noun (e.g., "Which book do you want?"; "The house which Jack built").

whose.definition: used as an interrogative or relative pronoun to ask or indicate to whom something belongs (e.g., "Whose book is this?"; "the person whose car was stolen" )

how many.definition: (interrogative pronoun) Used to ask about the number or quantity of people or things (e.g., “How many apples are there?”).

whom.definition: object form of the pronoun 'who', used to refer to the person or people receiving an action or affected by it (e.g., "To whom did you give the book?").

exist.definition: to have objective reality or being.

remain.definition: to continue to exist; to stay.

live.definition: to be alive; to reside in a place.

appear.definition: to become visible; to show up.

stay.definition: to remain in a place or condition.

destroy.definition: to put an end to the existence of something by damaging or attacking it.

break.definition: to separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain.

demolish.definition: to completely destroy a building or structure.

crush.definition: to press or squeeze with force so as to break or damage.

smash.definition: to break something violently into pieces.

ruin.definition: to damage something so severely that it loses all value or usefulness.

shatter.definition: to break suddenly into many small pieces.

become.definition: to begin to be; to undergo change or development.

turn.definition: to change in nature, state, or condition.

grow.definition: to increase in size, amount, or degree; to develop.

start.definition: to begin or set in motion.

want.definition: to desire or wish for something.

feel.definition: to experience a feeling or emotion.

prefer.definition: to like one thing more than another.

regret.definition: to feel sorry or disappointed about something.

forgive.definition: to stop feeling angry at someone for an offense.

build.definition: to construct by putting parts or materials together.

write.definition: to compose text or a literary work.

design.definition: to plan and create the form or structure of something.

compose.definition: to create a work of music or writing.

invent.definition: to create or design something that has not existed before.

be.definition: to exist or to be in a particular state or identity.

make (earn).definition: to earn or gain, especially money.

buy.definition: to purchase in exchange for money.

give.definition: to hand or pass something to someone; to give.

take.definition: to take or get into one's possession.

drink.definition: to swallow or consume a liquid.

sleep.definition: to rest in sleep; to be asleep.

play.definition: to engage in a game or activity for enjoyment.

work.definition: to do a job or perform labor.

put.definition: to place something in a particular position.

keep.definition: to retain or continue to have.

use.definition: to employ or put into service for a purpose.

help.definition: to assist or give support to someone.

open.definition: to move so as to allow access or passage.

close.definition: to shut or make something no longer open.

hold.definition: to grasp, carry, or keep in the hands.

catch.definition: to capture or seize something in motion.

throw.definition: to propel something through the air with force.

pull.definition: to exert force to move something toward oneself.

push.definition: to exert force to move something away from oneself.

lift.definition: to raise to a higher position.

carry.definition: to transport from one place to another.

touch.definition: to come into physical contact with.

cut.definition: to make an opening with a sharp tool.

burn.definition: to be on fire or damage with heat.

wear.definition: to have clothing on the body.

sit.definition: to rest with the body supported by the buttocks.

stand.definition: to be in an upright position on the feet.

lie.definition: to be in a horizontal resting position.

bend.definition: to curve or cause to curve.

shake.definition: to move rapidly back and forth.

hide.definition: to put out of sight; to conceal.

hang.definition: to attach or suspend from above.

wait.definition: to stay in a place until a particular time or event.

meet.definition: to come together with or encounter.

join.definition: to connect with or become part of.

fit.definition: to be the right size or shape.

lose.definition: to misplace something or no longer have it.

win.definition: to achieve victory in a contest.

save.definition: to store safely for future use.

spread.definition: to extend over a larger area.

shoot.definition: to fire a weapon or projectile.

draw.definition: to sketch or depict with lines.

drive.definition: to operate and travel in a vehicle.

go.definition: to move from one place to another.

come.definition: to move toward the speaker or a place.

return.definition: to go back to a place or condition.

leave.definition: to go away from a place; to depart.

move.definition: to change position or go from one place to another.

pass.definition: to go past or move by something.

bring.definition: to carry or take something to a place.

reach.definition: to arrive at or get to a place.

send.definition: to cause to go to another place.

ride.definition: to travel on or in a vehicle or animal.

lead (guide).definition: to guide or show the way.

cross.definition: to go from one side to the other.

travel.definition: to go from place to place.

talk.definition: to speak in order to give information or express ideas.

speak.definition: to say words aloud; to use the voice to communicate.

tell.definition: to communicate information or facts to someone.

ask.definition: to say something in order to obtain an answer or information.

call.definition: to cry out or shout; to summon by name.

shout.definition: to speak or cry out loudly.

whisper.definition: to speak very softly or quietly.

reply.definition: to respond to something that has been said or written.

explain.definition: to make something clear by describing it in detail.

announce.definition: to make a public statement about something.

discuss.definition: to talk about something with another person or group.

describe.definition: to give an account of something in words.

suggest.definition: to put forward an idea for consideration.

promise.definition: to assure someone that one will do something.

warn.definition: to inform someone of a possible danger or problem.

hear.definition: to perceive sound with the ears.

taste.definition: to perceive the flavor of something.

look.definition: to direct the eyes toward something.

watch.definition: to look at or observe attentively.

learn.definition: to gain knowledge or skill through study or experience.

teach.definition: to instruct or show someone how to do something.

read.definition: to understand written words or text.

know.definition: to have knowledge or awareness of something.

think.definition: to use the mind to consider or reason.

need.definition: to require or be in need of something.

mean.definition: to signify or have a particular meaning.

understand.definition: to comprehend or grasp the meaning of something.

wish.definition: to desire or hope for something.

seem.definition: to appear to be; to give the impression of being.

suppose.definition: to assume or think something is true.

guess.definition: to estimate or suppose without enough information.

expect.definition: to anticipate or regard as likely.

accept.definition: to receive or agree to something offered.

choose.definition: to select or pick between options.

dare.definition: to have the courage to do something.

realize.definition: to become aware of or understand something clearly.

study.definition: to spend time learning about a subject.

decide.definition: to make a choice or judgment.

recognize.definition: to identify from previous knowledge or experience.

agree.definition: to have the same opinion; to consent or accept.

nod.definition: to move the head up and down as a sign of agreement or greeting.

stare.definition: to look fixedly or intently with wide-open eyes.

young.definition: having lived or existed for only a short time; not old.

old.definition: having lived or existed for a long time; not young or new.

child.definition: a young human being between infancy and adolescence.

adult.definition: a person who has reached full physical and mental maturity.

bell pepper.definition: A large mild-flavored vegetable of the pepper family (Capsicum), typically green, red, yellow, or orange, with a hollow interior and seeds; also called sweet pepper or capsicum.

bank.definition: the land alongside or sloping down to a river or lake

state.definition: the particular condition that someone or something is in at a specific time

cousin.definition: a child of one's uncle or aunt; a relative who shares a common grandparent (gender-neutral term)

older brother.definition: a male sibling who is older than oneself

younger brother.definition: a male sibling who is younger than oneself

older sister.definition: a female sibling who is older than oneself

younger sister.definition: a female sibling who is younger than oneself

brother-in-law.definition: the brother of one's spouse, or the husband of one's sibling

sister-in-law.definition: the sister of one's spouse, or the wife of one's sibling

stepfather.definition: the husband of one's mother who is not one's biological father

stepmother.definition: the wife of one's father who is not one's biological mother

stepson.definition: a male child of one's spouse from a previous relationship

stepdaughter.definition: a female child of one's spouse from a previous relationship

south korea.definition: a country in East Asia occupying the southern portion of the Korean Peninsula; officially the Republic of Korea, bordered by North Korea to the north; capital: Seoul.

thailand.definition: a country in Southeast Asia on the Indochinese Peninsula; officially the Kingdom of Thailand, bordered by Myanmar, Laos, Cambodia, and Malaysia; capital: Bangkok.

vietnam.definition: a country in Southeast Asia on the eastern coast of the Indochinese Peninsula; officially the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, bordered by China, Laos, and Cambodia; capital: Hanoi.

south africa.definition: a country at the southern tip of Africa; officially the Republic of South Africa, bordered by Namibia, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, and Eswatini; capitals: Pretoria (administrative), Cape Town (legislative), Bloemfontein (judicial).

egypt.definition: a country in northeastern Africa and the Sinai Peninsula of southwestern Asia; officially the Arab Republic of Egypt, bordered by Libya, Sudan, Israel, and the Gaza Strip; capital: Cairo.

lion.definition: A large wild cat with a tawny coat and, in the male, a flowing mane; native to Africa and parts of Asia.

monkey.definition: A small to medium-sized primate typically having a long tail, living in trees in tropical regions.

deer.definition: A hoofed grazing mammal with branched antlers in the male, found in forests and grasslands worldwide.

fox.definition: A small to medium-sized wild canine with a pointed muzzle, bushy tail, and reddish fur, known for cunning.

bee.definition: A flying insect known for producing honey and beeswax, and for pollinating flowers.

ant.definition: A small social insect living in organized colonies, known for strength and industriousness.

dolphin.definition: A highly intelligent marine mammal with a streamlined body and a beak-like snout, known for playful behavior.

penguin.definition: A flightless seabird of the Southern Hemisphere with black and white plumage and flipper-like wings for swimming.

giraffe.definition: A tall African mammal with a very long neck and legs, and a distinctive spotted coat pattern.

zebra.definition: An African wild horse with black and white stripes, living in herds on grasslands.

crocodile.definition: A large semiaquatic reptile with a long snout, powerful jaws, and a thick scaly hide, found in tropical regions.

donkey.definition: A domesticated hoofed mammal related to the horse, with long ears and a braying call, used as a beast of burden.

rat.definition: A medium-sized rodent with a pointed snout and a long scaly tail, larger than a mouse.

parrot.definition: A tropical bird with a curved beak and brightly colored plumage, often able to mimic human speech.

pigeon.definition: A stout-bodied bird with a small head, commonly found in urban areas worldwide.

bat.definition: A nocturnal flying mammal with membranous wings, using echolocation to navigate.

camel.definition: A large long-necked mammal with one or two humps, adapted to desert life and used for transport.

cider.definition: An alcoholic or non-alcoholic beverage made from fermented apple juice.

beverage.definition: Any type of drink, especially one other than water.

juice.definition: A liquid extracted from fruits or vegetables, commonly consumed as a drink.

lemonade.definition: A sweetened beverage made from lemon juice, water, and sugar.

hot chocolate.definition: A warm beverage made from chocolate or cocoa powder mixed with milk or water.

smoothie.definition: A thick, creamy drink made by blending fruits, vegetables, and often yogurt or milk.

cocktail.definition: An alcoholic drink consisting of a mixture of spirits and other ingredients such as fruit juice or cream.

liquor.definition: A distilled alcoholic beverage with high alcohol content, such as whiskey, vodka, or rum.

whiskey.definition: A distilled alcoholic beverage made from fermented grain mash, typically aged in wooden casks.

vodka.definition: A clear distilled alcoholic beverage originating from Eastern Europe, typically made from fermented grains or potatoes.

rum.definition: A distilled alcoholic beverage made from sugarcane byproducts such as molasses or sugarcane juice.

champagne.definition: A sparkling wine produced in the Champagne region of France, often associated with celebrations.

sake.definition: A Japanese alcoholic beverage made from fermented rice.

printer.definition: a machine that produces text or images on paper or other media from digital data

photo camera.definition: A device for capturing still photographs using a light-sensitive sensor or photographic film.

television.definition: a device that receives broadcast or recorded visual and audio signals and displays them as moving images and sound; also the system of broadcasting programs for such devices

radio.definition: a device for receiving and transmitting sound programmed broadcasts over electromagnetic waves; (also) the system of broadcasting and receiving audio signals via radio waves

speaker.definition: a device that converts electrical audio signals into sound that can be heard; a loudspeaker

headphones.definition: A pair of small loudspeakers worn over or in the ears to listen to audio privately.

charger.definition: A device used to restore electrical energy to a rechargeable battery or battery-powered device.

battery.definition: a device that stores chemical energy and provides electrical power to a circuit; a group of one or more electrochemical cells (e.g., AA batteries)

calculator.definition: A device used to perform mathematical calculations, usually electronic and portable.

screen.definition: the flat surface of an electronic device on which images or data are displayed

video camera.definition: A device for recording moving images and sound onto a storage medium.

neighbor.definition: a person who lives near or next to another

guest.definition: a person who is invited to visit or stay in someone's home, or who is entertained at an event

hero.definition: a person admired for courage, outstanding achievements, or noble qualities

victim.definition: a person who has been harmed, injured, or killed as a result of a crime, accident, or other event

youth.definition: a young person, typically an adolescent or teenager

parent.definition: a person's father or mother; someone who has begotten or raised a child

grandchild.definition: a child of one's son or daughter

grandparent.definition: a parent of one's father or mother; a grandmother or grandfather

soldier.definition: A person who serves in an army or military force.

waiter.definition: A person whose job is to serve food and drinks to customers at a restaurant or similar establishment.

pharmacist.definition: A person qualified to prepare and dispense medicinal drugs in a pharmacy.

architect.definition: A person who designs buildings and oversees their construction.

scientist.definition: A person who studies or has expert knowledge in one or more of the natural or physical sciences.

actor.definition: A person who performs a role in a play, movie, television show, or other dramatic production.

judge.definition: A public official appointed or elected to hear and decide cases in a court of law.

hairdresser.definition: A person whose occupation is to cut, style, and arrange people's hair.

prof..definition: a title used before the name of a university professor

someone.definition: an unspecified or unknown person; a person who is not identified or named (e.g., "Someone left their umbrella here.")

anyone.definition: any person; any individual, regardless of identity

medium.definition: Of intermediate size; neither large nor small.

enormous.definition: Very large in size, quantity, or extent.

miniature.definition: Very small; much smaller than normal.

orange (color).definition: Having the color between red and yellow; resembling the color of a ripe orange fruit.

purple.definition: Having a color intermediate between red and blue.

curved.definition: Having a smooth, gradually bending line or surface; not straight or angular.

hollow.definition: Having an empty space or cavity inside; not solid.

spiral.definition: Winding in a continuous curve around a central point or axis.

previous.definition: Existing or occurring before in time or order.

following.definition: Coming after or as a result of; next in order or time.

humble.definition: Having or showing a modest estimate of one's own importance; not arrogant.

stubborn.definition: Having or showing dogged determination not to change one's attitude or position; obstinate.

loyal.definition: Showing firm and constant support or allegiance to a person or institution.

disgusted.definition: Feeling strong disapproval or revulsion aroused by something unpleasant.

ashamed.definition: Feeling embarrassed or guilty because of one's actions, characteristics, or associates.

relieved.definition: No longer feeling distressed or anxious; feeling reassurance after worry.

while.definition: During the time that; at the same time as; whereas (e.g., "while I was sleeping").

although.definition: In spite of the fact that; even though (e.g., "although it was late, she continued working").

whether.definition: Introducing alternatives or expressing doubt or choice (e.g., "whether or not", "I don't know whether he is coming").

this morning.definition: During the morning of the present day.

this afternoon.definition: During the afternoon of the present day.

this evening.definition: During the evening of the present day.

early.definition: before the usual or expected time; near the beginning of a period or event

late.definition: after the usual or expected time; not on time

meanwhile.definition: At the same time; in the intervening period.

afterward.definition: At a later or subsequent time; subsequently.

beforehand.definition: Before an action or event; in advance.

temporarily.definition: For a limited period of time; not permanently.

permanently.definition: In a way that lasts or remains unchanged indefinitely; for all time.

momentarily.definition: For a very short time; briefly.

extremely.definition: To a very great degree; exceedingly.

partly.definition: To some extent; not completely or fully.

fully.definition: Completely or entirely; to the fullest extent.

once.definition: On one occasion or for one time only; at some time in the past.

likewise.definition: In the same way; also; similarly.

wow.definition: An exclamation expressing surprise, wonder, or amazement.

congratulations.definition: An expression used to praise someone for an achievement or special occasion.

cancer.definition: A serious disease in which cells in the body grow uncontrollably and can spread to other parts of the body.

diabetes.definition: A chronic metabolic disease characterized by high blood sugar levels due to the body's inability to produce or use insulin properly.

asthma.definition: A chronic respiratory condition causing difficulty breathing, wheezing, and shortness of breath due to narrowed airways.

wound.definition: An injury to the body in which the skin or other tissue is broken, cut, or punctured.

prison.definition: a building where people are kept as punishment for a crime or while awaiting trial

mosque.definition: a building used for Muslim worship and prayer

garage.definition: a building or part of a building used for housing motor vehicles

temple.definition: a building devoted to the worship of a god or gods, especially in religions other than Christianity and Islam

station (transportation).definition: a building or place where buses, trains, or other public transport vehicles stop for passengers to get on and off

stadium.definition: a large enclosed area with tiers of seats for spectators, used for sporting events and large-scale performances

palace.definition: a large and impressive building that is the official home of a king, queen, president, or other head of state

warehouse.definition: a large building used for storing goods and merchandise before they are distributed or sold

clinic.definition: a small medical facility where patients receive outpatient care, consultations, or specialized treatment, typically without overnight stays

studio (creative workspace).definition: a room or building where an artist, photographer, musician, or other creative professional works or where recordings and broadcasts are made

bowl.definition: A round, deep dish or basin used for holding food, liquid, or other items.

basket.definition: A container made of interwoven strips of material such as cane, straw, or wire, used for carrying or storing items.

envelope.definition: A flat paper container with a sealable flap, used for enclosing and sending a letter or document.

jar.definition: A wide-mouthed container, typically made of glass or ceramic, used for storing food, preserves, or other items.

tray.definition: A flat, shallow container with a raised rim, used for carrying, holding, or displaying items.

bucket.definition: A cylindrical open container with a handle, used for carrying liquids or other materials.

pot (cooking).definition: A deep, round cooking vessel with a handle or handles and often a lid, used for boiling, stewing, or preparing food on a stovetop.

brush (hair).definition: A handheld grooming tool with bristles set into a flat or rounded base, used for smoothing, detangling, or styling hair.

sponge.definition: A soft, porous material used for absorbing liquids, cleaning surfaces, or bathing.

clip (fastener).definition: A small device, typically of metal or plastic, used for holding things together or attaching one thing to another.

coin.definition: A small, flat, usually round piece of metal issued by a government as money.

needle (sewing).definition: A thin, pointed piece of metal with an eye at one end, used for sewing by passing thread through fabric.

ball (sphere).definition: A round object, typically hollow or solid, used in games or sports, or any spherical object.

ribbon.definition: A long, narrow strip of fabric used for tying, decorating, or wrapping.

lighter.definition: A small portable device that produces a flame, used for lighting cigarettes, candles, or fires.

cork (bottle stopper).definition: A small cylindrical piece of cork or similar material used to seal the opening of a bottle.

eraser.definition: A small piece of rubber or similar material used to remove pencil marks from paper.

screw.definition: A threaded metal fastener driven by turning with a screwdriver.

bolt.definition: A threaded metal pin used with a nut to fasten things together.

boot.definition: A sturdy item of footwear that covers the foot and extends up to the ankle or higher, worn for protection, warmth, or fashion.

necklace.definition: A piece of jewelry consisting of a chain, string of beads, or decorative band worn around the neck for adornment.

t-shirt.definition: A casual, short-sleeved garment for the upper body, typically made of cotton, with a round neckline and no collar or buttons.

nail.definition: a small pointed metal pin hammered into wood or other material to fasten things together

shovel.definition: a hand tool with a broad blade and a handle used for digging or moving loose material

axe.definition: a hand tool with a heavy blade on a handle used for chopping wood

rope.definition: a thick strong cord made by twisting or braiding fibers together, used for pulling, tying, or climbing

pliers.definition: a hand tool with two hinged arms and serrated jaws used for gripping, bending, or cutting wire and small objects

rake.definition: a garden tool with a row of tines on a long handle, used for gathering leaves or smoothing soil

tape.definition: a strip of flexible material coated with adhesive, used for sticking things together or sealing

paintbrush.definition: a brush used for applying paint to surfaces

highway.definition: A main road, especially one connecting major towns or cities, designed for fast long-distance travel by vehicles.

sidewalk.definition: A paved path for pedestrians alongside a road.

intersection.definition: A point where two or more roads meet or cross each other.

crosswalk.definition: A marked part of a road where pedestrians have the right of way to cross.

railroad.definition: A track made of steel rails along which trains run, or the system of transportation using such tracks.

lead.definition: a heavy, soft, gray metallic element (symbol Pb)

cement.definition: a powdery substance made of calcined lime and clay, mixed with water to form a paste that hardens into a solid; used as a binding agent in concrete and mortar

wax.definition: a soft, moldable substance that is solid at room temperature and melts easily when heated, produced naturally by bees or synthetically from petroleum; used for candles, polishes, and coatings
